trans-unit.source: Defines a flexible grid area that consists of columns and rows.
A Grid contains a collection of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects, which are in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel.Children%2A> property.
Columns and rows that are defined within a Grid can take advantage of <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType> sizing to distribute remaining space proportionally.
When <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType> is selected as the height or width of a row or column, that column or row receives a weighted proportion of the remaining available space.
This is in contrast to <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType>, which distributes space evenly based on the size of the content that is within a column or row.
This value is expressed as `*` or `2*` when you use [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)].
In the first case, the row or column would receive one times the available space, while in the second case, the row or column would receive two times the available space, and so on.

By combining this technique to proportionally distribute space with a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment%2A> value of `Stretch`, it is possible to partition layout space by percentage of screen space.
Grid is the only layout panel that can distribute space in this manner.
By default, rows and columns take up the least amount of space necessary to accommodate the largest content within any cell contained in a given row or column.

For example, if a column has one cell with a long word like "hippopotamus" contained within it but all the other cells in the column have smaller words like "dog", the width of the column will be the width of the largest word (hippopotamus).
You can precisely position child elements of a Grid by using a combination of the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Margin%2A> property and alignment properties.
Child elements of a Grid are drawn in the order in which they appear in markup or code.
As a consequence, layered order (also known as z-order) can be achieved when elements share the same coordinates.
Grid and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> share some common functionality, but each can be applied in appropriate scenarios to better use its built-in features.
Grid adds elements based on a row and column index; <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> does not.
The Grid element allows layering of content, where more than one element can exist within a single cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> does not support layering.
Child elements of a Grid can be absolutely positioned relative to the upper-left corner of their "cell" boundaries.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> does not support this feature.
Grid also offers more flexible resizing behavior than <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table>.
Grid uses the <xref:System.Windows.GridLength> object to define the sizing characteristics of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition>.
For a definition of each unit type, see <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType>.

If a child element is added to a column within a Grid, and the column has its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.Width%2A> property set to `Auto`, the child will be measured without restrictions.
This behavior can prevent horizontal scroll bars from displaying if a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> is being used, as the child element is measured as unbounded.
For purposes of display, the child is clipped rather than scrolled.
Panel elements do not receive focus by default.
To compel a panel element to receive focus, set the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A> property to `true`.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.
Arranges the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> element.
Specifies the size this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> element should use to arrange its child elements.
<xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the arranged size of this Grid element and its children.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> defined on this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.
## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *OneOrMoreColumnDefinitions* One or more elements.
Each such <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> becomes a placeholder representing a column in the final grid layout.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> defined on this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.Column*> attached property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.ColumnSpan*> attached property.
To be added.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.Column*> attached property from a given <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The element from which to read the property value.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.Column*> attached property.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.ColumnSpan*> attached property from a given <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The element from which to read the property value.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.ColumnSpan*> attached property.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.IsSharedSizeScope*> attached property from a given <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The element from which to read the property value.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.IsSharedSizeScope*> attached property.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.Row*> attached property from a given <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The element from which to read the property value.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.Row*> attached property.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.RowSpan*> attached property from a given <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The element from which to read the property value.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.RowSpan*> attached property.
Gets the child at the specified index position.
The visual tree must not be modified while this method is called.
The zero-based index position of the desired <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref>.
The child at the specified index position.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.IsSharedSizeScope*> attached property.
To be added.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate the logical children of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
This property has no default value.
Measures the children of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> in anticipation of arranging them during the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.ArrangeOverride*> pass.
Indicates an upper limit size that should not be exceeded.
<xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the required size to arrange child content.
Called when the visual children of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> element change.
Identifies the visual child that's added.
Identifies the visual child that's removed.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinitionCollection"></xref> defined on this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.
## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *OneOrMoreRowDefinitions* One or more elements.
Each such <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> becomes a placeholder representing a row in the final grid layout.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinitionCollection"></xref> defined on this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.

The property value to set.

Returns true if <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> associated with this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> is not empty.
true if <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinitionCollection"></xref> associated with this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> is not empty; otherwise, false.
Returns true if <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinitionCollection"></xref> associated with this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> is not empty.
true if <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinitionCollection"></xref> associated with this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> is not empty; otherwise, false.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether grid lines are visible within this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.
Enabling grid lines creates dotted lines around all the elements within a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>.
Only dotted lines are available because this property is intended as a design tool to debug layout problems and is not intended for use in production quality code.
If you want lines inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>, style the elements within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid> to have borders.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if grid lines are visible; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid.ShowGridLines*> dependency property.
To be added.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
Gets a value that represents the total number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> children within this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref>.
The visual tree must not be modified during a call to this method.
<xref:System.Int32> that represents the total number of child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects.
The default value is zero.
